Sentencas: Exsolution of catalytic nanoparticles (NPs) from perovskites has arisen as a flexible method to develop high-performance functional materials with enhanced durability for energy conversion and catalytic synthesis applications.
Titulo: Unveiling the Interface Structure of the Exsolved Co-Fe Alloy Nanoparticles from Double Perovskite and Its Application in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Here, we unravel the interface structure of the in situ exsolved alloy nanoparticles from the double perovskite substrate on the atomic scale.
Titulo: Unveiling the Interface Structure of the Exsolved Co-Fe Alloy Nanoparticles from Double Perovskite and Its Application in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The results show that the Co-Fe alloy NPs exsolved topologically from the {100} facets terminations of the Sr2FeMo0.65Co0.35O6-delta (SFMC) double perovskite along < 100 > directions exhibiting the same orientation and identical crystal structure.
Titulo: Unveiling the Interface Structure of the Exsolved Co-Fe Alloy Nanoparticles from Double Perovskite and Its Application in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The lattice planes of these two phases align and insert into each other at the interface, forming a smooth and continuous coherent connection.
Titulo: Unveiling the Interface Structure of the Exsolved Co-Fe Alloy Nanoparticles from Double Perovskite and Its Application in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The presence of moire patterns at the interface confirms the topological exsolution mechanism.
Titulo: Unveiling the Interface Structure of the Exsolved Co-Fe Alloy Nanoparticles from Double Perovskite and Its Application in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The coherent interface can significantly reduce the interfacial energy and therefore stabilize the exsolved nanoparticles.
Titulo: Unveiling the Interface Structure of the Exsolved Co-Fe Alloy Nanoparticles from Double Perovskite and Its Application in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Therefore, excellent and stable electrochemical performance of the NP-decorated SFMC perovskite is observed as the anode for solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Unveiling the Interface Structure of the Exsolved Co-Fe Alloy Nanoparticles from Double Perovskite and Its Application in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Our contribution promotes a fundamental understanding of the interface structure of the in situ exsolved alloy nanoparticles from perovskite substrate.
Titulo: Unveiling the Interface Structure of the Exsolved Co-Fe Alloy Nanoparticles from Double Perovskite and Its Application in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells
